columns.name: sky_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for each sky position

columns.name: obj_id
columns.comment: Object ID in the sky catalog

columns.name: obj_id_orig
columns.comment: Original object ID in the sky catalog

columns.name: target_type_id
columns.comment: target_type_id from the target_type table (must be 2 for SKY)

columns.name: mag_thresh
columns.comment: Sky intensity threshold in mag/arcsec^2 (only for HSC-SSP).

columns.name: version
columns.comment: Version string of the sky position

indexes.name: sky_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX sky_pkey ON public.sky USING btree (sky_id)

indexes.name: sky_sky_id_key
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX sky_sky_id_key ON public.sky USING btree (sky_id)

indexes.def: CREATE INDEX sky_q3c_ang2ipix_idx ON public.sky USING btree (q3c_ang2ipix(ra, "dec"))

indexes.name: ix_sky_input_catalog_id
indexes.def: CREATE INDEX ix_sky_input_catalog_id ON public.sky USING btree (input_catalog_id)

indexes.name: ix_sky_version
indexes.def: CREATE INDEX ix_sky_version ON public.sky USING btree (version)

columns.name: fluxstd_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier for each flux standard star

columns.name: pmra
columns.comment: Proper motion in right ascension direction (mas/yr)

columns.name: tract
columns.comment: same definition as HSC-SSP?; can be derived from the coordinate

columns.name: patch
columns.comment: same definition as HSC-SSP?; can be derived from the coordinate; Note that it's defined as an integer

columns.name: target_type_id
columns.comment: target_type_id from the target_type table (must be 3 for FLUXSTD)

columns.name: prob_f_star
columns.comment: Probability of being an F-type star

columns.name: flags_dist
columns.comment: Distance uncertanty flag, True if parallax_error/parallax > 0.2

columns.name: flags_ebv
columns.comment: E(B-V) uncertainty flag, True if E(B-V) uncertainty is greater than 20%

columns.name: version
columns.comment: Version string of the F-star selection

columns.name: psf_mag_error_g
columns.comment: Error in g-band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_mag_error_r
columns.comment: Error in r-band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_mag_error_i
columns.comment: Error in i-band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_mag_error_z
columns.comment: Error in z-band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_mag_error_y
columns.comment: Error in y-band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_mag_error_j
columns.comment: Error in J band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_flux_error_j
columns.comment: Error in J band PSF flux (nJy)

columns.name: teff_brutus_low
columns.comment: Lower confidence level (16%) of effective temperature from Brutus code [K]

columns.name: teff_brutus_high
columns.comment: Upper confidence level (84%) of effective temperature from Brutus code [K]

columns.name: logg_brutus
columns.comment: Surface gravity from Brutus code [log cgs]

columns.name: logg_brutus_low
columns.comment: Lower confidence level (16%) of surface gravity from Brutus code [log cgs]

columns.name: logg_brutus_high
columns.comment: Upper confidence level (84%) of surface gravity from Brutus code [log cgs]

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX fluxstd_pkey ON public.fluxstd USING btree (fluxstd_id)

indexes.def: CREATE INDEX fluxstd_q3c_ang2ipix_idx ON public.fluxstd USING btree (q3c_ang2ipix(ra, "dec"))

indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX uq_obj_id_input_catalog_id_version ON public.fluxstd USING btree (obj_id, input_catalog_id, version)

indexes.name: ix_fluxstd_version
indexes.def: CREATE INDEX ix_fluxstd_version ON public.fluxstd USING btree (version)

columns.name: obj_id
columns.comment: Object ID as specified by the observer at Phase 2 (can be same as the input_catalog_object_id)

columns.name: pmra
columns.comment: Proper motion in right ascension direction (mas/yr)

columns.name: tract
columns.comment: same definition as HSC-SSP?; can be derived from the coordinate

columns.name: patch
columns.comment: same definition as HSC-SSP?; can be derived from the coordinate; Note that it's defined as an integer

columns.name: input_catalog_id
columns.comment: Input catalog ID from the input_catalog table

columns.name: fiber_mag_g
columns.comment: g-band magnitude within a fiber (AB mag)

columns.name: fiber_mag_r
columns.comment: r-band magnitude within a fiber (AB mag)

columns.name: fiber_mag_i
columns.comment: i-band magnitude within a fiber (AB mag)

columns.name: fiber_mag_z
columns.comment: z-band magnitude within a fiber (AB mag)

columns.name: fiber_mag_y
columns.comment: y-band magnitude within a fiber (AB mag)

columns.name: fiber_mag_j
columns.comment: J band magnitude within a fiber (AB mag)

columns.name: priority
columns.comment: Priority of the target specified by the observer within the proposal

columns.name: is_medium_resolution
columns.comment: True if the medium resolution mode is requested

columns.name: qa_relative_throughput
columns.comment: Relative throughput to the reference value requested by the observer (default: 1.0)

columns.name: qa_relative_noise
columns.comment: Relative noise to the reference value requested by the observer (default: 1.0)

columns.name: qa_reference_lambda
columns.comment: Reference wavelength to evaluate effective exposure time (angstrom or nm?)

columns.name: is_cluster
columns.comment: True if it is a cluster of multiple targets.

columns.name: psf_mag_error_g
columns.comment: Error in g-band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_mag_error_r
columns.comment: Error in r-band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_mag_error_i
columns.comment: Error in i-band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_mag_error_z
columns.comment: Error in z-band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_mag_error_y
columns.comment: Error in y-band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_mag_error_j
columns.comment: Error in J band PSF magnitude (AB mag)

columns.name: psf_flux_error_j
columns.comment: Error in J band PSF flux (nJy)

columns.name: ob_code
columns.comment: Identifer for a combination of a target, observing mode, and exposure time in a program.

indexes.name: target_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX target_pkey ON public.target USING btree (target_id)

indexes.name: target_target_id_key
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX target_target_id_key ON public.target USING btree (target_id)

indexes.def: CREATE INDEX target_q3c_ang2ipix_idx ON public.target USING btree (q3c_ang2ipix(ra, "dec"))

indexes.name: uq_proposal_id_ob_code
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX uq_proposal_id_ob_code ON public.target USING btree (proposal_id, ob_code)

columns.name: cluster_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier of clusters found at duplication checking

columns.name: n_targets
columns.comment: Number of targets in the cluster

columns.name: ra_cluster
columns.comment: Mean RA of targets in the cluster (ICRS, degree)

columns.name: dec_cluster
columns.comment: Mean Dec of targets in the cluster (ICRS, degree)

columns.name: input_catalog_id
columns.comment: Input catalog ID from the input_catalog table

indexes.name: cluster_pkey
indexes.def: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX cluster_pkey ON public.cluster USING btree (cluster_id, target_id)
